content.question:
Squalentem barbam et concretos sanguine crines

vulneraque illa gerens, quae circum plurima muros

accepit patrios. Ultro flens ipse videbar

compellare virum et maestas expromere voces:

5"O lux Dardaniae, spes o fidissima Teucrum,

quae tantae tenuere morae? Quibus Hector ab oris

exspectate venis? Ut te post multa tuorum

funera, post varios hominumque urbisque labores

defessi aspicimus! Quae causa indigna serenos

10foedavit vultus? Aut cur haec vulnera cerno?"

Aeneid 2. 277-286

Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question.

1. In line 1-3 (Squalentem . . . patrios), (A) which two Latin words characterize the hair of the person mentioned here? (B) Translate them in context.

2. (A) Identify two first person verbs in this passage and (B) translate each verb in context.

3. In lines 1-4 (Squalentem . . . voces), which two Latin words indicate that Aeneas is sad?

4. In lines 5-9 (O lux . . . aspicimus), which four Latin words ask Hector why he did not come earlier?

5. (A) What is the case of exspectate (line 7) ? (B) Translate exspectate in context together with what it modifies.

6. (A) Identify one and only one literary device found in line 8 (funera . . . labores) and (B) write out the Latin word or words that illustrate that device.

7. (A) What are the case and number of defessi (line 9) ? (B) Who or what does defessi modify?

8. (A) What are the case and number of vultus (line 10) ? (B) Translate vultus in context together with the adjective that modifies it.

9. In Book 1, (A) on which building does Aeneas see the addressee depicted? (B) Who gave this person (the addressee) his wounds?

vulneraque illa gerens, quae circum plurima muros

accepit patrios. Ultro flens ipse videbar

compellare virum et maestas expromere voces:

quae tantae tenuere morae? Quibus Hector ab oris

exspectate venis? Ut te post multa tuorum

funera, post varios hominumque urbisque labores

defessi aspicimus! Quae causa indigna serenos

10foedavit vultus? Aut cur haec vulnera cerno?"

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
